isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - SHIFT LEVER AND TOWER ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: 8.8.1. Aluminum Shift Lever and Tower Assembly

figure.caption: Figure 291. Aluminum Shift Lever And Tower Assembly

note.para: If an aluminum housing is being replaced, replace the entire assembly with a cast iron shift tower housing.

step1.para: Put the housing in a vise with brass jaws. Make sure the outside of the housing is toward you.

note.para: Two or three spring washers may be installed in the housing. Make sure the same number of washers are installed.

step1.para: Install the spring washers in the bottom of the housing. Make sure the large ends of the washers touch and the bevels of the washers are installed away from each other as shown in Figure 292.

figure.caption: Figure 292. Install Spring Washers In Housing Bottom

step1.para: Install the lower retainer plate in the housing. Make sure the tabs of the retainer are in the slots in the housing.
Install the lever so that the slots in the lever are installed over the pins (Figure 293).

Install the upper retainer plate over the lever and in the housing. Make sure the tabs on the plate are installed in the slots in the housing. On some housings, make sure the pins in the plate are aligned with the slots in the ball on the lever (Figure 293).

figure.caption: Figure 293. Install Lever and Upper Retainer Plate

step1.para: Install the snap ring that fastens the upper retainer plate and the lever in the housing (Figure 294).
Install and tighten the set screw that fastens the upper retainer plate in the housing ( Figure 295).

figure.caption: Figure 295. Install and Tighten Set Screw

step1.para: Install the boot on the housing. Makes sure the lip on the boot is installed in the groove in the housing. Install the clamps or cable ties that fasten the boot to the lower lever and the housing (Figure 296).
Install the upper shift lever assembly on the lower lever. Make sure the bores for the retainers are aligned ( Figure 297).
If clips are used, install a bushing in each side. Install a clip on one end of the pin. Install the pin in the bores. Install the clip on the other end of the pin.
If a bolt and nut is used, install the bolt in the bores. Install and tighten the nut to 11 to 16 Nm (8 to 12 ft-lbs.).

figure.caption: Figure 297. Install Upper Shift Lever Assembly on Lower Lever

svcsubproc.title: 8.8.2 Cast Iron Shift Lever and Tower Assembly

figure.caption: Figure 298. Cast Iron Shift Lever And Tower Assembly

step1.para: Put the assembly in a vise with brass jaws. Make sure the outside of the housing is toward you.
Install the lower lever in the housing. Make sure the slots on the ball of the lever are aligned with the pins in the housing.
Install the spacer over the lower lever. Install the assembly in the housing.
Install the spring over the lower lever in the housing.
Install the spiral snap ring over the lower lever in the housing. Make sure the snap ring is completely installed in the groove in the housing.
Install the boot on the housing. Make sure the lip on the boot is installed in the groove in the housing. Install new cable ties that fasten the boot to the housing.
Install the upper lever to the lower lever. Make sure the bores for the retainers are aligned (Figure 299).
If clips are used, install a bushing in each side. Install a clip on one end of the pin. Install the pin in the bores. Install the clip on the other end of the pin.
If a bolt and nut are used, install the bolt in the bores. Install and tighten the nut to 11 to 16 Nm (8 to 12 ft-lbs.

figure.caption: Figure 299. Install Upper Lever To Lower Lever
